title: A Note on the Hausdorff Distance between Norm Balls and their Linear Maps
abstract:
Abstract
We consider the problem of computing the (two-sided) Hausdorff distance between the unit ℓp1subscriptℓsubscript𝑝1\ell_{p_{1}} and ℓp2subscriptℓsubscript𝑝2\ell_{p_{2}} norm balls in finite dimensional Euclidean space for 1≤p1<p2≤∞1subscript𝑝1subscript𝑝21\leq p_{1}<p_{2}\leq\infty, and derive a closed-form formula for the same. We also derive a closed-form formula for the Hausdorff distance between the k1subscript𝑘1k_{1} and k2subscript𝑘2k_{2} unit D𝐷D-norm balls, which are certain polyhedral norm balls in d𝑑d dimensions for 1≤k1<k2≤d1subscript𝑘1subscript𝑘2𝑑1\leq k_{1}<k_{2}\leq d. When two different ℓpsubscriptℓ𝑝\ell_{p} norm balls are transformed via a common linear map, we obtain several estimates for the Hausdorff distance between the resulting convex sets. These estimates upper bound the Hausdorff distance or its expectation, depending on whether the linear map is arbitrary or random. We then generalize the developments for the Hausdorff distance between two set-valued integrals obtained by applying a parametric family of linear maps to different ℓpsubscriptℓ𝑝\ell_{p} unit norm balls, and then taking the Minkowski sums of the resulting sets in a limiting sense. To illustrate an application, we show that the problem of computing the Hausdorff distance between the reach sets of a linear dynamical system with different unit norm ball-valued input uncertainties, reduces to this set-valued integral setting.
